description: Quantum theory provides the fundamental underpinning of modern physical science, yet its philosophical implications are so shocking that Einstein could not accept them. By following the historical development of 20th century quantum science, the student should gain an appreciation of how a scientific theory grows and develops, and of the strong interplay between scientific observation and philosophical interpretation. Although students will not be expected to carry out methematical derivations, they should gain an understanding of basic quantum findings.
name: TOPICS COGNIT PH-PS: Freud and the Search for Meaning in Contemporary Culture
